title: Budae Jjigae (Korean Army Base Stew)
ingredients: 1 (12 ounce) can fully cooked luncheon meat (such as SPAM®), sliced
14 ounces smoked sausage (such as Eckrich®), sliced
¼ cup Korean red pepper powder
7 ¾ ounces ramen noodles (such as Ottogi Ramyonsari®)
method: Step 1: Divide luncheon meat into 2 piles on either side of a stock pot. Layer sausage, onion, and kimchi on top, leaving an empty space in the center of the pot.

Step 2: Mix red pepper powder, soy sauce, gochujang, garlic, and black pepper together in a small bowl. Pour into the center of the pot. Sprinkle in green onion. Pour in chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until flavors combine, about 10 minutes.

Step 3: Bring a pot of water to a boil. Add ramen noodles. Cook, stirring until partially cooked and softened, about 2 minutes. Drain, and transfer to the pot with meat-kimchi mixture. Cook, stirring until ramen noodles are tender but firm to the bite, about 5 minutes. Top stew with American cheese.
Step 4: Anchovy broth can be substituted for the chicken broth if desired.
